content.description:
Flawless rock, sustained movement, and a heady move up high all contribute to a stellar problem in this pristine zone. I was dumbfounded this hasn't been cleaned and published by now, maybe it's the sketchy landing ;) Regardless, this is either a great warm-up for the Punchdance problems, or a worthy objective on its own. Just don't fuck up the last move....

Begin sitting at the center of the East face with your left hand on a big sloping edge and your right hand low on a crimpy, sidepull flake. Move up and slightly right. Some moves are a little reachy, hence the slash grade.

The crux is high and committing, and the landing less than ideal. I sorely wished I had a second pad and/or a spotter, but hey, it's the Quarantine Boulder, you're on your own down here!
content.protection: Social distance, hand washing, and courage.
